title: Raman and RMCD Study of 4Hb-TaS2
description: Polarization-resolved Raman and RMCD measurements on 4Hb-TaS2 samples of varying thicknesses (4L, 6L, 11L, bulk) in an Attodry cryostat. The study investigates the behavior of Charge Density Wave (CDW) amplitude modes and the Higgs mode as a function of laser power, temperature, and magnetic field. Circular polarization-resolved Raman spectroscopy is also performed to probe the material's chiral properties. The data is analyzed for spectral weight transfer and compared with previous results on NbSe2.

[Slide 5]
NbSe2 has 100% of spectral weight transfer from CDW amplitude modes to Higgs mode. Intensity of CDW mode decreases by 50%.
No significant spectral weight change (~13% between different powers) observed here, especially on cross-polarization configuration (276 degree).
CDW amplitude modes in TaS2 also much narrower (5 cm-1) and further from the Higgs mode compared to NbSe2 (20 cm-1), so hard to tell where isosbestic point will be.
